P.title: Will the Nebraska Senate pass a total abortion ban by July 2024?
P.body: This question will resolve as YES if, by July 31, 2024, the Nebraska Senate successfully passes legislation enacting a total abortion ban. For the purpose of this question, a 'total abortion ban' refers to legislation that prohibits all or nearly all abortions, with possible exceptions only for cases involving rape, incest, or threat to the mother's life. The passage of such legislation must be confirmed through official Nebraska legislative records. If no such legislation is passed by the specified date, or if only partial restrictions are enacted, the question will resolve as NO. Note that this question only concerns the passage of the bill in the Senate, not its final enactment into law.

P.title: Will NASA's Orion capsule complete a crewed return mission from the ISS by August 2024?
P.body:
This question will resolve as YES if, by August 31, 2024, NASA's Orion capsule successfully completes a crewed return mission from the International Space Station (ISS) to Earth. For a positive resolution:

1. The mission must involve the Orion capsule transporting at least one human crew member from the ISS back to Earth.
2. The capsule must land safely with all crew members in good health.
3. The mission's success must be officially confirmed by NASA or another authoritative space agency.
4. The confirmation must be reported by at least two major, reputable news outlets (e.g., Associated Press, Reuters, BBC, CNN, New York Times).

The question will resolve as NO if:
- No such mission occurs by the specified date.
- A mission is attempted but fails to meet all the above criteria.
- The Orion capsule is used only for uncrewed missions or launches to the ISS without a return flight.

Note: This question does not consider test flights or simulations. Only actual crewed return missions from the ISS count towards resolution.

- No such mission takes place by the specified date.

- The Orion spacecraft is used solely for uncrewed missions or launches to the ISS without a return journey.

P.title: Will Massachusetts hold a referendum on abortion rights by August 2024?
P.body:
This question will resolve as YES if, by August 31, 2024, Massachusetts officially conducts a public referendum specifically focused on enshrining protection for abortion rights in the state. For a positive resolution:

1. The referendum must be officially announced and conducted by the Massachusetts state government.
2. The referendum must explicitly address the issue of abortion rights protection.
3. The results of the referendum must be publicly reported by official state channels or widely recognized news sources.

The question will resolve as NO if:

1. No such referendum occurs by August 31, 2024.
2. A planned referendum is cancelled or postponed beyond the specified date.
3. A referendum is held, but it does not specifically focus on enshrining protection for abortion rights.

Note: This question does not consider the outcome of the referendum, only whether it takes place within the specified timeframe.

The current rate of 5.25%-5.50% is considered a 23-year high as of October 2023. Confirmation must come from official Federal Reserve announcements or at least two reputable financial news sources (e.g., Bloomberg, Reuters, Wall Street Journal, CNBC). If the rate is reported to have decreased below 5.25% and remains below this level throughout August 2024, the question resolves as NO. Note that this question does not predict when rate cuts might begin, only whether the rate will remain at or above the current 23-year high level by August 2024.

P.title: Will Wisconsin hold a referendum on mental health services funding by August 2024?

This question will resolve as YES if, by August 31, 2024, Wisconsin conducts an official public referendum specifically focused on increasing funding for mental health services in the state. For a YES resolution, the following criteria must be met:

1. The referendum must be officially announced and conducted by the state of Wisconsin.
2. The primary focus of the referendum must be on mental health services funding.
3. The results of the referendum must be publicly reported by official state channels or widely recognized news sources.

The enactment must be verified through formal state legislation or government declarations, and covered by a minimum of two major national news organizations (such as Associated Press, Reuters, CNN, Fox News, or MSNBC). The delay period must be exactly 72 hours; any other durations do not count. If no additional state implements such a policy by the deadline, or if the delays are for different durations, the inquiry concludes with a NO.

This question will resolve as YES if Rosé, a member of the K-pop group Blackpink, performs a solo act at the Global Citizen Festival held in Central Park, New York City, by July 31, 2024. For a positive resolution, the following criteria must be met:

1. The performance must be officially confirmed by the Global Citizen Festival organizers.
2. Rosé must perform individually, not as part of Blackpink or any other group.
3. The event must take place in Central Park, New York City.
4. The performance must be reported by at least two reputable news sources.

If any of these criteria are not met, or if no such performance occurs by July 31, 2024, the question will resolve as NO.

P.title: Will the Taiwan Weighted Index reach or exceed 20,000 points by August 2024?
P.body: This question will resolve as YES if, at any point between October 1, 2023 and August 31, 2024, the Taiwan Weighted Index reaches or exceeds 20,000 points. The 20,000 point level is chosen as a representative value that the index might have been at before a significant drop. Verification will be based on official index reports from reputable financial market data providers such as Bloomberg, Reuters, or the Taiwan Stock Exchange. If the index does not reach 20,000 points during this period, the question resolves as NO. Note that intraday highs count for resolution; the index does not need to close at or above 20,000 points.

P.title: Will Columbus Craft Meats issue a recall of salami products due to a listeria outbreak by August 2024?
P.body:
This question will resolve as YES if, by August 31, 2024, Columbus Craft Meats officially announces a recall of any of its salami products due to a listeria outbreak. The recall must be confirmed through at least one of the following sources:

1. An official announcement on Columbus Craft Meats' website or social media channels
2. A press release from Columbus Craft Meats
3. An announcement from the U.S. Food and Drug Administration (FDA) or the Centers for Disease Control and Prevention (CDC) specifically mentioning a Columbus Craft Meats recall
4. Reports from at least three major news outlets (e.g., Reuters, Associated Press, CNN, New York Times) citing official sources

The recall must explicitly mention listeria as the reason for the product withdrawal. If no such recall meeting these criteria is announced by the specified date, the question will resolve as NO.

P.body:
This question will resolve as YES if, by August 31, 2024, Maryland officially conducts a public referendum specifically focused on enshrining protection for abortion rights in the state. For a positive resolution:

1. The referendum must be officially announced and conducted by the Maryland state government.
2. The referendum must explicitly address the issue of abortion rights protection.
3. The results of the referendum must be publicly reported by official state channels or widely recognized news sources.

The question will resolve as NO if:

P.title: Will China's Shenzhou spacecraft complete a crewed return mission from the ISS by August 2024?
P.body:
This question will resolve as YES if, by August 31, 2024, China's Shenzhou spacecraft successfully completes a crewed return mission from the International Space Station (ISS) to Earth. For a positive resolution:

1. The mission must involve the Shenzhou spacecraft transporting at least one human crew member from the ISS back to Earth.
2. The spacecraft must land safely with all crew members in good health.
3. The mission's success must be officially confirmed by CNSA or another authoritative space agency.
4. The confirmation must be reported by at least two major, reputable news outlets (e.g., Associated Press, Reuters, BBC, CNN, New York Times).

The question will resolve as NO if:
- No such mission occurs by the specified date.
- A mission is attempted but fails to meet all the above criteria.
- The Shenzhou spacecraft is used only for uncrewed missions or launches to the ISS without a return flight.

Note: This question does not consider test flights or simulations. Only actual crewed return missions from the ISS count towards resolution.

article_information.article_content: WASHINGTON (AP) A federal appeals court has allowed the U.S. Education Department to move ahead with a plan to lower monthly payments for millions of student loan borrowers, putting on hold a ruling … [+2556 chars]

perplexity_verification.chain_of_thought:
To resolve this question, I've checked the following sources:
    1. Official government announcements and websites related to student loan policies.
    2. Major reputable news outlets including ABC News, The Sydney Morning Herald, and The Australian.

    The Australian government has proposed changes to the indexation amounts that apply to Higher Education Loan Program (HELP) student loans from 2023 onwards. Specifically, the government has decided to calculate the annual indexation based on the lesser of the Consumer Price Index (CPI) and the Wage Price Index (WPI), instead of solely on CPI. This change aims to prevent student debts from growing faster than wages.

    Education Minister Jason Clare announced that this change would "wipe out what happened last year and make sure it never happens again," referring to the high 7.1% indexation increase in 2023, which will be retroactively reduced to 3.2%.

    This policy change directly impacts the amount of debt owed by students and, by extension, can lower the monthly payments required to repay these loans. The implementation of this plan has been confirmed by official announcements and reported by major news outlets, such as ABC News.

    Given this information, it is clear that the Australian government has implemented a plan to lower student loan payments by changing the indexation method, which aligns with the criteria for resolving this question positively.

For the purpose of this question, a recession is defined as two consecutive quarters of negative GDP growth as reported by the U.S. Bureau of Economic Analysis. The question resolves as NO if the U.S. economy experiences two consecutive quarters of negative GDP growth at any point between October 1, 2023, and July 31, 2024. The current interest rate environment should not be explicitly mentioned in the resolution criteria.

perplexity_verification.chain_of_thought:
The question asks if the Brazilian economy will avoid a recession by July 2024, defined as two consecutive quarters of negative GDP growth. To resolve this, we need to examine the economic indicators and reports up to July 2024.

    1. **Economic Indicators**: The Conference Board Leading Economic Index (LEI) for Brazil increased by 0.5 percent in July 2024, indicating a positive economic trajectory in the near term. However, the LEI contracted by 1.2 percent over the six-month period between January and July 2024, suggesting a moderation in economic growth.

    2. **IMF Projections**: The IMF projected a growth rate of 2.1 percent for Brazil in 2024, indicating a slowdown but not a recession.

    3. **Central Bank Data**: The Central Bank's economic activity index (IBC-Br) recorded a 0.4 percent drop in July, but this single month's decline does not constitute a recession as defined by two consecutive quarters of negative GDP growth.

    4. **Recession Definition**: The question's criteria for a recession (two consecutive quarters of negative GDP growth) are not met based on the available data up to July 2024.

    Given these points, the Brazilian economy did not enter a recession by July 31, 2024, according to the provided definitions and data.

P.title: Will Kentucky enact new abortion regulations stricter than those for other healthcare providers by July 2024?

The enactment must be confirmed by official state legislative documentation or reported by at least two reputable news sources. Stricter requirements may include, but are not limited to, additional licensing, reporting, or facility standards specific to abortion providers. P.title: Will the United States maintain a 100% tariff on Chinese-made medical equipment through August 2024?
P.body: This question will resolve as YES if, as of August 31, 2024, the United States continues to impose a 100% tariff on imports of Chinese-made medical equipment. The existence and rate of the tariff must be verifiable through official U.S. government sources (such as the Office of the United States Trade Representative or the U.S. Department of Commerce) and corroborated by at least two reputable news organizations (e.g., Reuters, Bloomberg, The Wall Street Journal, The New York Times). If the tariff is reduced below 100% or completely removed at any point up to and including August 31, 2024, the question will resolve as NO. Temporary suspensions or waivers of the tariff that are explicitly stated to be temporary and do not permanently alter the 100% rate will not affect the resolution of this question.

P.title: Will Elon Musk conduct a live interview with Mark Zuckerberg on X by August 2024?
P.body:
This question resolves as YES if Elon Musk conducts a live interview with Mark Zuckerberg on X (formerly known as Twitter) by August 31, 2024. For a positive resolution, the following criteria must be met:

1. The interview must be conducted live on the X platform.
2. Elon Musk must be the primary interviewer.
3. Mark Zuckerberg must be the interviewee.
4. The event must be officially announced by X or Elon Musk prior to its occurrence.
5. The interview must be publicly accessible on the X platform.
6. At least two major news outlets (such as CNN, Fox News, MSNBC, Reuters, or Associated Press) must report on the event either before or after it takes place.

If all these conditions are met by August 31, 2024, the question resolves as YES. If any of these conditions are not met by this date, or if the interview does not occur, the question resolves as NO.

P.title: Will the Dream Chaser spacecraft complete a crewed return mission from the ISS by August 2024?
P.body:
This question will resolve as YES if, by August 31, 2024, the Dream Chaser spacecraft successfully completes a crewed return mission from the International Space Station (ISS) to Earth. For a positive resolution:

1. The mission must involve the Dream Chaser spacecraft transporting at least one human crew member from the ISS back to Earth.
2. The spacecraft must land safely with all crew members in good health.
3. The mission's success must be officially confirmed by Sierra Nevada Corporation or another authoritative space agency.
4. The confirmation must be reported by at least two major, reputable news outlets (e.g., Associated Press, Reuters, BBC, CNN, New York Times).

The question will resolve as NO if:
- No such mission occurs by the specified date.
- A mission is attempted but fails to meet all the above criteria.
- The Dream Chaser spacecraft is used only for uncrewed missions or launches to the ISS without a return flight.

Note: This question does not consider test flights or simulations. Only actual crewed return missions from the ISS count towards resolution.

P.title: Will Japan announce plans to build additional nuclear reactors beyond the current two by July 2024?
P.body: This question will resolve as YES if, by July 31, 2024, the Japanese government officially announces plans to build more nuclear reactors beyond the two currently planned. The announcement must come from an official government source, such as the Prime Minister's office or the Ministry of Economy, Trade and Industry, and be reported by at least two major international news outlets (e.g., Reuters, Associated Press, BBC, or Bloomberg). The announcement must clearly indicate an intention to construct additional reactors beyond the two already planned, not just expansions or modifications to the existing plans. If no such announcement is made by the resolution date, or if the announcement only reaffirms or provides updates on the existing two-reactor plan, the question will resolve as NO.
